00075 /* ---------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
00076 /* FUNCTION  isNumber(char *s):                                                 */
00077 /* It checks the passing character is a number or not, return 0 if its a        */
00078 /* otherwise returns 1.                                                         */
00079 /* ---------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
00080 
00081         int isNumber(char *s)
00082         {
00083             int dot=0, num=0, end=0;
00084 
00085             while(isspace(*s))s++;
00086             if(*s == '-')s++;
00087             if(! *s)return 0;
00088             while(*s)
00089                 if(isspace(*s))
00090                     end=1, s++;
00091                 else if(end)
00092                     return 0;
00093                 else if(isdigit(*s))
00094                     num=1, s++;
00095                 else if(*s=='.')
00096                     if(dot)
00097                         return 0;  
00098                     else
00099                         dot=1,s++;        
00100                 else
00101                     return 0;
00102             return num;
00103         };
00104

00106 /* ---------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
00107 /* FUNCTION  destroy (GtkWidget *widget, gpointer udata):                       */
00108 /* It Destroy(close) the iPDC main window with child (if any open) and          */      
00109 /* also close the opened terminal.                                              */
00110 /* ---------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
00111 
00112         void destroy (GtkWidget *widget, gpointer udata)
00113         {
00114                 FILE *f;
00115                 char name[20],*psid,*psname,psN[15];
00116 
00117                 g_print ("\niPDC Closing....Bye\n\n");
00118                 system(" ps ux | awk '/bash/ && !/awk/ {print $2 ,$7}'>names.txt");
00119                 f = fopen("names.txt","r");
00120 
00121                 /* closing both the iPDC and extra termial we opened for displaying data */
00122                 int flag = 0;   
00123                 if (f != NULL)
00124                 {
00125                         memset(name,'\0',20);
00126                         memset(psN,'\0',15);
00127                         while (fgets (name, 20,f) != NULL)
00128                         {
00129                                 psid = strtok (name," "); 
00130                                 psname = strtok (NULL," "); 
00131                                 strncpy(psN,psname,5);
00132                                 if(strstr(tname,psN)) 
00133                                 {
00134                                         flag = 1;                       
00135                                         break;
00136                                 }       
00137                         }
00138                         if(flag)
00139                         {
00140                                 if(!kill(atoi(psid), SIGKILL))
00141                                 {
00142                                         printf("Sent a SIGKILL signal to Process ID %d\n",atoi(psid));
00143                                 } 
00144                                 else 
00145                                 {
00146                                         printf("Signal not sent to %d\n",(int)psid);
00147                                 }
00148                         }
00149                         fclose(f);
00150                         remove("names.txt");
00151                         exit(1);
00152                 } else {        
00153         
00154                         perror("names.txt");
00155         
00156                 }       
00157                 gtk_main_quit();
00158                 exit(1);
00159         };

00164 /* It displays the details of running iPDC software on your machine             */

00166 /* ---------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
00167 
00168         void display_pdc_detail (GtkButton *widget, gpointer udata)
00169         {
00170                 /* local variables */
00171                 char line[20];
00172                 char *markup;
00173                 GtkWidget *new_window, *table;
00174                 GtkWidget *label, *ok_button;
00175                 FILE *file_1;  
00176 
00177                 /* Open the file 'pdc.txt' in read mode */
00178                 file_1 = fopen ("pdc.txt","r");
00179                 if (file_1 != NULL)
00180                 {
00181                         /* If its available, then create a new dialog window for displaying the iPDC details. */
00182                         new_window = gtk_dialog_new ();
00183                         g_signal_connect (new_window, "destroy", G_CALLBACK (gtk_widget_destroy), new_window);
00184                         gtk_window_set_title (GTK_WINDOW (new_window), "iPDC Details");
00185                         gtk_container_set_border_width (GTK_CONTAINER (new_window), 10);
00186                         gtk_widget_set_size_request (new_window, 350, 350);
00187         
00188                         /* create a table of 6 by 2 squares. */
00189                         table = gtk_table_new (6, 2, FALSE);
00190     
00191                         /* set the spacing to 10 on x and 10 on y */
00192                         gtk_table_set_row_spacings (GTK_TABLE (table), 10);
00193                         gtk_table_set_col_spacings (GTK_TABLE (table), 10);
00194             
00195                         /* pack the table into the window */
00196                         gtk_box_pack_start (GTK_BOX (GTK_DIALOG(new_window)->vbox), table, TRUE, TRUE, 0);
00197                         gtk_widget_show (table);
00198                         
00199                         /* Add a "close" button to the bottom of the dialog */
00200                         ok_button = gtk_button_new_with_label ("OK");
00201 
00202                         /* This simply creates a grid of labels on the table to demonstrate the window. 
00203                            g_markup_printf_escaped (): function to display diffrent color and font of text on label */
00204                         label = gtk_label_new (" ");
00205                         markup = g_markup_printf_escaped ("<span foreground=\"#990033\" font='12'><b>iPDC Details</b></span>");
00206                         gtk_label_set_markup (GTK_LABEL (label), markup);
00207                         gtk_table_attach_defaults (GTK_TABLE (table), label, 0, 2, 0, 1);
00208                         gtk_widget_show (label);
00209                         g_free (markup);
00210 
00211                         label = gtk_label_new ("iPDC ID Code      ");
00212                         gtk_table_attach_defaults (GTK_TABLE (table), label, 0, 1, 1, 2);
00213                         gtk_widget_show (label);
00214          
00215                         label = gtk_label_new ("iPDC UDP Port     ");
00216                         gtk_table_attach_defaults (GTK_TABLE (table), label, 0, 1, 2, 3);
00217                         gtk_widget_show (label);
00218 
00219                         label = gtk_label_new ("iPDC TCP Port      ");
00220                         gtk_table_attach_defaults (GTK_TABLE (table), label, 0, 1, 3, 4);
00221                         gtk_widget_show (label);
00222          
00223                         label = gtk_label_new ("Database Server IP");
00224                         gtk_table_attach_defaults (GTK_TABLE (table), label, 0, 1, 4, 5);
00225                         gtk_widget_show (label);
00226 
00227                         label = gtk_label_new ("Database Server Port");
00228                         gtk_table_attach_defaults (GTK_TABLE (table), label, 0, 1, 5, 6);
00229                         gtk_widget_show (label);
00230 
00231                         /* This simply read from file and print on label in the table. */
00232                         memset(line,'\0',sizeof(line));
00233                         fgets (line, 20, file_1);
00234                         label = gtk_label_new (line);
00235                         gtk_table_attach_defaults (GTK_TABLE (table), label, 1, 2, 1, 2);
00236                         gtk_widget_show (label);
00237 
00238                         memset(line,'\0',sizeof(line));
00239                         fgets (line, 20, file_1);                                                               
00240                         label = gtk_label_new (line);
00241                         gtk_table_attach_defaults (GTK_TABLE (table), label, 1, 2, 2, 3);
00242                         gtk_widget_show (label);
00243 
00244                         memset(line,'\0',sizeof(line));
00245                         fgets (line, 20, file_1);                                                               
00246                         label = gtk_label_new (line);
00247                         gtk_table_attach_defaults (GTK_TABLE (table), label, 1, 2, 3, 4);
00248                         gtk_widget_show (label);
00249  
00250                         memset(line,'\0',sizeof(line));
00251                         fgets (line, 20, file_1);                                                               
00252                         label = gtk_label_new (line);
00253                         gtk_table_attach_defaults (GTK_TABLE (table), label, 1, 2, 4, 5);
00254                         gtk_widget_show (label);
00255                         fclose (file_1);
00256                 
00257                         /* This is print static text (9000) on label in the table. */
00258                         label = gtk_label_new ("9000");
00259                         gtk_table_attach_defaults (GTK_TABLE (table), label, 1, 2, 5, 6);
00260                         gtk_widget_show (label);
00261 
00262                         /* Define signal on ok_button when it "clicked". */
00263                         g_signal_connect_swapped (ok_button, "clicked", G_CALLBACK (gtk_widget_destroy), new_window);
00264             
00265                         /* This makes it so the ok_button is the default. */
00266                         gtk_widget_set_can_default (ok_button, TRUE);
00267                         gtk_box_pack_start (GTK_BOX (GTK_DIALOG (new_window)->action_area), ok_button, TRUE, TRUE, 0);
00268             
00269                         /* This grabs this button to be the default button. Simply hitting the "Enter" key will cause this button to activate. */
00270                         gtk_widget_grab_default (ok_button);
00271                         gtk_widget_show (ok_button);
00272 
00273                         /* Finally show the new_window. */
00274                         gtk_widget_show (new_window);
00275                 }
00276         };

00329 
00330                 /* Ensure that the dialog box is destroyed when the user responds */
00331                 g_signal_connect_swapped (help_dialog, "response", G_CALLBACK (gtk_widget_destroy), help_dialog);
00332

00340 /* It displays the status message of last performed operation.                  */
00341 /* ---------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
00342 
00343         void validation_result (char *msg)
00344         {
00345                 /* local variables */
00346                 GtkWidget *val_dialog;
00347 
00348                 /* Create a new about dialog to displaying the status message of last performed operation. */
00349                 val_dialog = gtk_about_dialog_new ();
00350 
00351                 /* Define the diffrent properties of val_dialog. */
00352                 gtk_about_dialog_set_program_name ((GtkAboutDialog *)val_dialog, " ");
00353                 gtk_about_dialog_set_comments ((GtkAboutDialog *)val_dialog, msg);
00354                 
00355                 /* Ensure that the dialog box is destroyed when the user responds */
00356                 g_signal_connect_swapped (val_dialog, "response", G_CALLBACK (gtk_widget_destroy), val_dialog);
00357 
00358                 /* Finally show the val_dialog. */
00359                 gtk_widget_show_all (val_dialog);
00360         };

00422 /* ---------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
00423 /* FUNCTION  validation_pdc_detail (GtkButton *button, gpointer udata)          */
00424 /* It Validates the user enterd details for iPDC device. It gives the           */
00425 /* successful message and go ahead with entered data if all entries             */
00426 /* were right, else it shows the validation error message to user.              */
00427 /* ---------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
00428 
00429         int validation_pdc_detail (GtkButton *button, gpointer udata)
00430         {
00431                 /* local variables */
00432                 char *errmsg1, ip[20];
00433                 const char *text, *text1, *text2, *text3;
00434         
00435                 /* Get the text entries filled by user */
00436                 text = gtk_entry_get_text(GTK_ENTRY(p_id));
00437                 text1 = gtk_entry_get_text(GTK_ENTRY(p_udp));
00438                 text2 = gtk_entry_get_text(GTK_ENTRY(p_tcp));
00439                 text3 = gtk_entry_get_text(GTK_ENTRY(p_ip));
00440                 memset(ip,'\0',20);
00441                 strcat(ip, text3);
00442 
00443                 if (!isNumber((char *)text))            /* Check text_box entry for valid integer or not?  */
00444                 { 
00445                         errmsg1 = "\tPlease enter valid value for iPDC ID code\t\n";
00446                         validation_result (errmsg1);            /* Show the unsuccess message to user */
00447                         return 0;
00448                 }
00449                 else if(text1 != NULL && (atoi(text1) < 2000 || (atoi(text1) > 65535)))         /* Check text_box entry for valid port number or not? */        
00450                 { 
00451                         errmsg1 = "\tPlease enter valid value for iPDC UDP Port\t\n";
00452                         validation_result (errmsg1);            /* Show the unsuccess message to user */
00453                         return 0;
00454                 }
00455                 else if((text2 != NULL) && ((atoi(text2) < 2000 || (atoi(text2) > 65535)) || (atoi(text2) == atoi(text1)))) /* TCP port should not match with UDP */                    
00456                 { 
00457                         errmsg1 = "\tPlease enter valid value for iPDC TCP Port,\nand it should be other then UDP Port";
00458                         validation_result (errmsg1);            /* Show the unsuccess message to user */
00459                         return 0;
00460                 }
00461                 else if(!checkip(ip))           /* Check text_box entry for valid IP Address or not? */         
00462                 {
00463                         errmsg1 = "Please enter valid IP Addess for iPDC Database Server\n";
00464                         validation_result (errmsg1);            /* Show the unsuccess message to user */
00465                         return 0;
00466                 }
00467                 else            /* Only if all the text_box entries were right */ 
00468                 {
00469                         FILE *fp_updc;
00470 
00471                         /* Open the file "pdc.txt" and write all the enterd informations */
00472                         fp_updc = fopen ("pdc.txt","w");
00473                         fputs(text, fp_updc);
00474                         fputc('\n',fp_updc);    
00475                         PDC_IDCODE = atoi(text);
00476 
00477                         fputs(text1, fp_updc);
00478                         fputc('\n',fp_updc);    
00479                         UDPPORT = atoi(text1);
00480 
00481                         TCPPORT = atoi(text2);
00482                         fputs(text2, fp_updc);
00483                         fputc('\n',fp_updc);    
00484 
00485                         fputs(text3, fp_updc);
00486                         strcpy(dbserver_ip, (char *) text3);
00487                         fclose(fp_updc);
00488 
00489                         /* Close/destroy the pdc_detail_window */
00490                         gtk_widget_destroy (pdc_detail_window);                 
00491 
00492                         /* Enable all (mentioned) buttons on main ipdc window */
00493                         gtk_widget_set_sensitive(GTK_WIDGET(data->add_pmu_button), TRUE);
00494                         gtk_widget_set_sensitive(GTK_WIDGET(data->remove_pmu_button), TRUE);
00495                         gtk_widget_set_sensitive(GTK_WIDGET(data->cmd_data_off_button), TRUE);
00496                         gtk_widget_set_sensitive(GTK_WIDGET(data->cmd_data_on_button), TRUE);
00497                         gtk_widget_set_sensitive(GTK_WIDGET(data->cmd_cfg_button), TRUE);
00498                         gtk_widget_set_sensitive(GTK_WIDGET(data->add_pdc_button), TRUE);
00499                         gtk_widget_set_sensitive(GTK_WIDGET(data->remove_pdc_button), TRUE);
00500                         gtk_widget_set_sensitive(GTK_WIDGET(data->display_conn_table_button), TRUE);
00501                         gtk_widget_set_sensitive(GTK_WIDGET(data->pdc_details_menuitem), TRUE);
00502 
00503                         /* Disable the menuitem for iPDC details entries */
00504                         gtk_widget_set_sensitive(GTK_WIDGET(data->enter_pdc_detail_menuitem), FALSE);
00505 
00506                         /* setup() call to stablish the connections at iPDC restart */
00507                         setup();
00508 
00509                         errmsg1 = "\t\tiPDC Setup Successfully Done\t\t\n";
00510                         validation_result (errmsg1);            /* Show the success message to user */
00511                         return 1;
00512                 }
00513         };
00514 
00515 
00516 /* ---------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
00517 /* FUNCTION  add_pmu_validation (GtkButton *but, gpointer udata)                */
00518 /* It Validates the user enterd details for add Source devices (PMU/PDC).       */
00519 /* It gives the successful message and go ahead with entered data if            */
00520 /* all entries were right, else it shows the validation error message to user.  */
00521 /* ---------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
00522 
00523         int add_pmu_validation (GtkButton *but, gpointer udata)
00524         {
00525                 /* local variables */
00526                 int ret;
00527                 char *errmsg1, ip[20], tmp[4];
00528                 const char *text, *text1, *text2, *text3;
00529 
00530                 /* Get the text entries filled by user */
00531                 text = gtk_entry_get_text(GTK_ENTRY(p_id));
00532                 text1 = gtk_entry_get_text(GTK_ENTRY(p_ip));
00533                 text2 = gtk_entry_get_text(GTK_ENTRY(p_port));
00534                 text3 = gtk_combo_box_get_active_text(GTK_COMBO_BOX(p_protocol));
00535                 memset(ip,'\0',20);
00536                 strcat(ip, text1);
00537                 strcpy (tmp, text3);
00538 
00539                 if ((!isNumber((char *)text)) || (atoi(text) == PDC_IDCODE))    /* Check text_box entry for valid integer or not? */
00540                 { 
00541                         errmsg1 = "Please enter valid value for source device ID code\n";
00542                         validation_result (errmsg1);            /* Show the unsuccess message to user */
00543                         return 0;
00544                 }
00545                 else if((!isNumber((char *)text2)) && ((atoi(text2) < 1500 || (atoi(text2) > 65535)) || (atoi(text2) == TCPPORT || atoi(text2) == UDPPORT || atoi(text2) == DBPORT)))           /* TCP and UDP port of iPDC should not match with it */
00546                 { 
00547                         errmsg1 = "\tPlease enter valid value for source device Port\t\n";
00548                         validation_result (errmsg1);            /* Show the unsuccess message to user */
00549                         return 0;
00550                 }
00551                 else if(!checkip(ip))           /* Check text_box entry for valid IP Address or not? */ 
00552                 {
00553                         errmsg1 = "\tPlease enter valid IP Addess of source device\t\n";
00554                         validation_result (errmsg1);            /* Show the unsuccess message to user */
00555                         return 0;
00556                 }
00557                 else            /* Only if all the text_box entries were right */ 
00558                 {
00559                         /* call add_PMU() to actual add pmu/pdc and start communication */ 
00560                         ret = add_PMU((char *)text, (char *)text1, (char *)text2, (char *)text3);
00561                         if (ret == 0)
00562                         {
00563                                 /* Close/destroy the add_pmu_window */
00564                                 gtk_widget_destroy (add_pmu_window);
00565                                                         
00566                                 errmsg1 = "\t\tSource Device Successfully Added\t\t\n";
00567                                 validation_result (errmsg1);            /* Show the success message to user */
00568                                 return 1;
00569                         }
00570                         else
00571                         {
00572                                 errmsg1 = "\t\tDevice details already exists\t\t\n";
00573                                 validation_result (errmsg1);            /* Show the unsuccess message to user */
00574                                 return 0;
00575                         }
00576                 }
00577         };
00578 
00579 
00580 /* ---------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
00581 /* FUNCTION  cmd_or_remove_pmu_validation (GtkButton *but, gpointer udata)      */
00582 /* It Validates the user enterd details for function Removes the Source devices */
00583 /* or send command frames to Source devices. It gives the successful message    */
00584 /* and go ahead with entered data if all entries were right,                    */
00585 /* else it shows the validation error message to user.                          */
00586 /* ---------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
00587 
00588         int cmd_or_remove_pmu_validation (GtkButton *but, gpointer udata)
00589         {
00590                 /* local variables */
00591                 int ret;
00592                 char *errmsg1, tmp[4];
00593                 const char *text, *text1;
00594         
00595                 /* Get the text entries filled by user */
00596                 text = gtk_entry_get_text(GTK_ENTRY(p_id));
00597                 text1 = gtk_combo_box_get_active_text(GTK_COMBO_BOX(p_protocol));
00598                 memset(tmp, '\0', 4);
00599                 strcpy (tmp, text1);
00600 
00601                 if (!isNumber((char *)text))            /* Check text_box entry for valid integer or not?  */
00602                 { 
00603                         errmsg1 = "\tPlease enter valid value for Source device ID code\t\n";
00604                         validation_result (errmsg1);
00605                         return 0;
00606                 }
00607                 else            /* Only if all the text_box entries were right */ 
00608                 {
00609                         if(!strcmp(find_butn, "1"))     /* If function called by 'Remove source device' */
00610                         {
00611                                 /* call remove_Lower_Node() to remove source device */ 
00612                                 ret = remove_Lower_Node((char *)text, (char *)text1);
00613                                 if (ret == 0)
00614                                 {
00615                                         /* Close/destroy the Source remove window */
00616                                         gtk_widget_destroy (new_window);                        
00617 
00618                                         errmsg1 = "\tSource device successfully removed\t\n";
00619                                         validation_result (errmsg1);            /* Show the success message to user */
00620                                         return 1;
00621                                 }
00622                                 else
00623                                 {
00624                                         errmsg1 = "\t\tEntered Source device not found\t\t\n";
00625                                         validation_result (errmsg1);            /* Show the unsuccess message to user */
00626                                         return 0;
00627                                 }
00628                         }
00629                         else if(!strcmp(find_butn, "2"))        /* If function called by 'Send Data Transmission OFF' */
00630                         {
00631                                 /* call put_data_transmission_off() to put OFF data of source device */ 
00632                                 ret = put_data_transmission_off((char *)text, (char *)text1);
00633                                 if (ret == 0)
00634                                 {
00635                                         /* Close/destroy the Send command frame window */
00636                                         gtk_widget_destroy (new_window);                        
00637                                         
00638                                         errmsg1 = "\tData Transmission put OFF\t\n";
00639                                         validation_result (errmsg1);            /* Show the success message to user */
00640                                         return 1;
00641                                 }
00642                                 else
00643                                 {
00644                                         errmsg1 = "\t\tEntered Source device not found\t\t\n";
00645                                         validation_result (errmsg1);            /* Show the unsuccess message to user */
00646                                         return 0;
00647                                 }
00648                         }
00649                         else if(!strcmp(find_butn, "3"))        /* If function called by 'Send Data Transmission ON' */
00650                         {
00651                                 /* call put_data_transmission_on() to put ON data of source device */ 
00652                                 ret = put_data_transmission_on((char *)text, (char *)text1);
00653                                 if (ret == 0)
00654                                 {
00655                                         /* Close/destroy the Send command frame window */
00656                                         gtk_widget_destroy (new_window);                        
00657                                         
00658                                         errmsg1 = "\tData Transmission put ON\t\n";
00659                                         validation_result (errmsg1);            /* Show the success message to user */
00660                                         return 1;
00661                                 }
00662                                 else
00663                                 {
00664                                         errmsg1 = "\t\tEntered Source device not found\t\t\n";
00665                                         validation_result (errmsg1);            /* Show the unsuccess message to user */
00666                                         return 0;
00667                                 }
00668                         }
00669                         else if(!strcmp(find_butn, "4"))        /* If function called by Send Configuration request */
00670                         {
00671                                 /* call configuration_request() to send Configuration request */ 
00672                                 ret = configuration_request((char *)text, (char *)text1);
00673                                 if (ret == 0)
00674                                 {
00675                                         /* Close/destroy the Send command frame window */
00676                                         gtk_widget_destroy (new_window);                        
00677                                         
00678                                         errmsg1 = "\t\tConfiguration Frame request sent\t\t\n";
00679                                         validation_result (errmsg1);            /* Show the success message to user */
00680                                         return 1;
00681                                 }
00682                                 else
00683                                 {
00684                                         errmsg1 = "\t\tEntered Source device not found\t\t\n";
00685                                         validation_result (errmsg1);            /* Show the unsuccess message to user */
00686                                         return 0;
00687                                 }
00688                         }
00689                         else
00690                         {
00691                                 errmsg1 = "\t\t\tUNKNOWN FUNCTION CALL\t\t\t\n";
00692                                 validation_result (errmsg1);                    /* Show the unsuccess message to user */
00693                                 return 1;
00694                         }
00695                 }
00696         };

00700 /* FUNCTION  new_pdc_validation (GtkButton *but, gpointer udata)                */

00703 /* all entries were right, else it shows the validation error message to user.  */
00704 /* ---------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
00705 
00706         int new_pdc_validation (GtkButton *but, gpointer udata)
00707         {
00708                 /* local variables */
00709                 int ret;
00710                 const char *text, *text1;
00711                 char *errmsg1, ip[20], tmp[6];
00712         
00713                 /* Get the text entries for PDC, filled by user */
00714                 text = gtk_entry_get_text(GTK_ENTRY(p_ip));
00715                 text1 = gtk_combo_box_get_active_text(GTK_COMBO_BOX(p_protocol));
00716                 memset(ip,'\0',20);
00717                 strcat(ip, text);
00718                 strcpy (tmp, text1);
00719 
00720                 if(!checkip(ip))                /* Check text_box entry for valid IP Address or not? */ 
00721                 {
00722                         errmsg1 = "\t\tPlease enter valid IP Addess of destination device\t\t\n";
00723                         validation_result (errmsg1);            /* Show the unsuccess message to user */
00724                         return 0;
00725                 }
00726                 else            /* Only if all the text_box entries were right */ 
00727                 {
00728                         /* call add_PDC() to actual add pdc and start communication */ 
00729                         ret = add_PDC((char *)text, (char *)text1);
00730                         if (ret == 0)
00731                         {
00732                                 gtk_widget_destroy (new_window);                        
00733                                 
00734                                 errmsg1 = "\tDestination device successfully added\t\n";
00735                                 validation_result (errmsg1);    /* Show the success message to user */
00736                                 return 1;
00737                         }
00738                         else
00739                         {
00740                                 errmsg1 = "\t\tDevice details already exists\t\t\n";
00741                                 validation_result (errmsg1);    /* Show the unsuccess message to user */
00742                                 return 0;
00743                         }
00744                 }

00748 /* ---------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
00749 /* FUNCTION  remove_pdc_validation (GtkButton *but, gpointer udata)             */
00750 /* It Validates the user enterd details for remove Destination devices as PDC.  */
00751 /* It gives the successful message and go ahead with entered data if            */
00752 /* all entries were right, else it shows the validation error message to user.  */
00753 /* ---------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
00754 
00755         int remove_pdc_validation (GtkButton *but, gpointer udata)
00756         {
00757                 /* local variables */
00758                 int ret;
00759                 const char *text, *text1, *text2;
00760                 char *errmsg1, ip[20], tmp[6];
00761         
00762                 /* Get the text entries for remove source device by user */
00763                 text = gtk_entry_get_text(GTK_ENTRY(p_ip));
00764                 text1 = gtk_entry_get_text(GTK_ENTRY(p_port));
00765                 text2 = gtk_combo_box_get_active_text(GTK_COMBO_BOX(p_protocol));
00766                 memset(ip,'\0',20);
00767                 strcat(ip, text);
00768                 strcpy (tmp, text2);
00769 
00770                 if(!isNumber((char *)text) && (atoi(text1) < 1500 || (atoi(text1) > 65535)))    /* Check text_box entry for valid port or not? */               
00771                 { 
00772                         errmsg1 = "\tPlease enter valid value for destination device Port\t\n";
00773                         validation_result (errmsg1);            /* Show the unsuccess message to user */
00774                         return 0;
00775                 }
00776                 else if(!checkip(ip))           /* Check text_box entry for valid IP Address or not? */ 
00777                 {
00778                         errmsg1 = "\tPlease enter valid IP Addess of destination device\t\n";
00779                         validation_result (errmsg1);            /* Show the unsuccess message to user */
00780                         return 0;
00781                 }
00782                 else            /* Only if all the text_box entries were right */ 
00783                 {
00784                         /* Call remove_PDC() to remove PDC device entry as well as objects if it presents */
00785                         ret = remove_PDC((char *)text, (char *)text1, (char *)text2);
00786                         if (ret == 0)
00787                         {
00788                                 /* Close/destroy the remove PDC window */
00789                                 gtk_widget_destroy (new_window);                
00790                                         
00791                                 errmsg1 = "\tDestination device successfully removed\t\n";
00792                                 validation_result (errmsg1);    /* Show the success message to user */
00793                                 return 1;
00794                         }
00795                         else
00796                         {
00797                                 errmsg1 = "\t\tEntered destination device not found\t\t\n";
00798                                 validation_result (errmsg1);    /* Show the unsuccess message to user */
00799                                 return 0;
00800                         }
00801                 }
00802         };

00804 
00805 /* ---------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
00806 /* FUNCTION  fill_pdc_details ()                                                */
00807 /* This function called by main once to accept the iPDC details from user       */
00808 /* on a 'iPDC Setup' window. If teher is already a file 'pdc.txt' available     */
00809 /* then it read the file and initialized them globally.                         */              
00810 /* ---------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
00811 
00812         void fill_pdc_details ()
00813         {
00814                 /* Open the file 'pdc.txt' in read mode */
00815                 FILE *file_1 = fopen ("pdc.txt","r");
00816                 if (file_1 != NULL)
00817                 {
00818                         char line[20];
00819 
00820                         /* If file is present initialize the global varialbes by details in file */
00821                         memset(line,'\0',sizeof(line));
00822                         fgets (line, 20, file_1);
00823                         PDC_IDCODE = atoi(line);
00824 
00825                         memset(line,'\0',sizeof(line));
00826                         fgets (line, 20, file_1);                                                               
00827                         UDPPORT = atoi(line);
00828 
00829                         memset(line,'\0',sizeof(line));
00830                         fgets (line, 20, file_1);                                                               
00831                         TCPPORT = atoi(line);
00832  
00833                         memset(line,'\0',sizeof(line));
00834                         fgets (line, 20, file_1);                                                               
00835                         strcpy(dbserver_ip, line);
00836                         fclose (file_1);
00837 
00838                         /* Desable the menuitem button if there is already enty for iPDC */
00839                         gtk_widget_set_sensitive(GTK_WIDGET(data->enter_pdc_detail_menuitem), FALSE);
00840 
00841                         /* Recreate the configuration objects and connection table */
00842                         recreate_cfg_objects();  
00843                         recreate_Connection_Table();
00844 
00845                         /* setup() call to stablish the connections if any */
00846                         setup();
00847                 }
00848                 else 
00849                 { 
00850                         /* local variables for iPDC Detail windows */
00851                         char *markup15;
00852                         GtkWidget *table, *label;
00853                         GtkWidget *valdbutton, *help_button;
00854           
00855                         /* Create a new dialog window for iPDC Setup */
00856                         pdc_detail_window = gtk_dialog_new ();
00857                         g_signal_connect (pdc_detail_window, "destroy", G_CALLBACK (gtk_widget_destroy), pdc_detail_window);
00858                         gtk_window_set_title (GTK_WINDOW (pdc_detail_window), "iPDC Setup");
00859                         gtk_container_set_border_width (GTK_CONTAINER (pdc_detail_window), 10);
00860                         gtk_widget_set_size_request (pdc_detail_window, 350, 350);
00861                  
00862                         /* Create a table of 6 by 2 squares. */
00863                         table = gtk_table_new (6, 2, FALSE);
00864             
00865                         /* Set the spacing to 15 on x and 25 on y */
00866                         gtk_table_set_row_spacings (GTK_TABLE (table), 15);
00867                         gtk_table_set_col_spacings (GTK_TABLE (table), 25);
00868             
00869                         /* Pack the table into the window */
00870                         gtk_box_pack_start (GTK_BOX (GTK_DIALOG(pdc_detail_window)->vbox), table, TRUE, TRUE, 0);
00871                         gtk_widget_show (table);
00872 
00873                         /* Add few button to the bottom of the dialog */
00874                         valdbutton = gtk_button_new_with_label ("Add");
00875                         help_button = gtk_button_new_with_label ("Help");
00876             
00877                         /* This simply creates a grid of toggle buttons on the table */
00878                         label = gtk_label_new (" ");
00879                         markup15 = g_markup_printf_escaped ("<span foreground=\"#990033\" font='12'><b>Fill iPDC Details</b></span>");
00880                         gtk_label_set_markup (GTK_LABEL (label), markup15);
00881                         gtk_table_attach_defaults (GTK_TABLE (table), label, 0, 2, 0, 1);
00882                         gtk_widget_show (label);
00883                         g_free (markup15);
00884          
00885                         label = gtk_label_new ("iPDC ID Code       ");
00886                         gtk_table_attach_defaults (GTK_TABLE (table), label, 0, 1, 1, 2);
00887                         gtk_widget_show (label);
00888          
00889                         label = gtk_label_new ("iPDC UDP Port      ");
00890                         gtk_table_attach_defaults (GTK_TABLE (table), label, 0, 1, 2, 3);
00891                         gtk_widget_show (label);
00892 
00893                         label = gtk_label_new ("iPDC TCP Port       ");
00894                         gtk_table_attach_defaults (GTK_TABLE (table), label, 0, 1, 3, 4);
00895                         gtk_widget_show (label);
00896          
00897                         label = gtk_label_new ("Database Server IP ");
00898                         gtk_table_attach_defaults (GTK_TABLE (table), label, 0, 1, 4, 5);
00899                         gtk_widget_show (label);
00900  
00901                         label = gtk_label_new ("Database Server Port");
00902                         gtk_table_attach_defaults (GTK_TABLE (table), label, 0, 1, 5, 6);
00903                         gtk_widget_show (label);
00904 
00905                         /* Create text boxes for user to enter appropriate values */
00906                         p_id = gtk_entry_new();
00907                         gtk_entry_set_max_length ((GtkEntry *)p_id, 5);
00908                         gtk_table_attach_defaults (GTK_TABLE (table), p_id, 1, 2, 1, 2);
00909                         gtk_widget_show (p_id);
00910  
00911                         p_udp = gtk_entry_new();
00912                         gtk_entry_set_max_length ((GtkEntry *)p_udp, 5);
00913                         gtk_table_attach_defaults (GTK_TABLE (table), p_udp, 1, 2, 2, 3);
00914                         gtk_widget_show (p_udp);
00915 
00916                         p_tcp = gtk_entry_new();
00917                         gtk_entry_set_max_length ((GtkEntry *)p_tcp, 5);
00918                         gtk_table_attach_defaults (GTK_TABLE (table), p_tcp, 1, 2, 3, 4);
00919                         gtk_widget_show (p_tcp);
00920  
00921                         p_ip = gtk_entry_new();
00922                         gtk_entry_set_max_length ((GtkEntry *)p_ip, 15);
00923                         gtk_table_attach_defaults (GTK_TABLE (table), p_ip, 1, 2, 4, 5);
00924                         gtk_widget_show (p_ip);
00925 
00926                         label = gtk_label_new ("9000");
00927                         gtk_table_attach_defaults (GTK_TABLE (table), label, 1, 2, 5, 6);
00928                         gtk_widget_show (label);
00929 
00930                         /* Disable all the (mentioned) buttons on main ipdc window */
00931                         gtk_widget_set_sensitive(GTK_WIDGET(data->add_pmu_button), FALSE);
00932                         gtk_widget_set_sensitive(GTK_WIDGET(data->remove_pmu_button), FALSE);
00933                         gtk_widget_set_sensitive(GTK_WIDGET(data->cmd_data_off_button), FALSE);
00934                         gtk_widget_set_sensitive(GTK_WIDGET(data->cmd_data_on_button), FALSE);
00935                         gtk_widget_set_sensitive(GTK_WIDGET(data->cmd_cfg_button), FALSE);
00936                         gtk_widget_set_sensitive(GTK_WIDGET(data->add_pdc_button), FALSE);
00937                         gtk_widget_set_sensitive(GTK_WIDGET(data->remove_pdc_button), FALSE);
00938                         gtk_widget_set_sensitive(GTK_WIDGET(data->display_conn_table_button), FALSE);
00939                         gtk_widget_set_sensitive(GTK_WIDGET(data->pdc_details_menuitem), FALSE);
00940                 
00941                         /* Signal handling for buttons on iPDC Setup Window */
00942                         g_signal_connect_swapped (pdc_detail_window, "destroy", G_CALLBACK (gtk_widget_destroy), pdc_detail_window);
00943                         g_signal_connect_swapped (valdbutton, "clicked", G_CALLBACK (validation_pdc_detail), NULL);
00944                         g_signal_connect_swapped (help_button, "clicked", G_CALLBACK (ipdc_help), NULL);
00945             
00946                         /* This makes it so the button is the default. */
00947                         gtk_widget_set_can_default (valdbutton, TRUE);
00948                         gtk_widget_set_can_default (help_button, TRUE);
00949                         gtk_box_pack_start (GTK_BOX (GTK_DIALOG (pdc_detail_window)->action_area), valdbutton, TRUE, TRUE, 0);
00950                         gtk_box_pack_start (GTK_BOX (GTK_DIALOG (pdc_detail_window)->action_area), help_button, TRUE, TRUE, 0);
00951             
00952                         /* This grabs this button to be the default button. Simply hitting the "Enter" key will cause this button to activate. */
00953                         gtk_widget_grab_default (valdbutton);
00954                         gtk_widget_show (valdbutton);
00955                         gtk_widget_grab_default (help_button);
00956                         gtk_widget_show (help_button);
00957 
00958                         /* Finally show the pdc_detail_window */
00959                         gtk_widget_show (pdc_detail_window);
00960                         validation_result ("\t\tEnter the details for iPDC setup.\t\t\n");                              
00961                 }
00962         };
00963         
00964 
00965 /* ---------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
00966 /* FUNCTION  add_pmu (GtkButton *but, gpointer udata)                           */
00967 /* It open the add source device dialog window, and user have to enter          */
00968 /* the source device details of which he wants to connect.                      */
00969 /* ---------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
00970 
00971         void add_pmu (GtkButton *but, gpointer udata)
00972         {
00973                 /* local variables */
00974                 char *markup1;
00975                 GtkWidget *table, *close_button;
00976                 GtkWidget *valdbutton, *help_button, *label;
00977 
00978                 /* Create a new dialog window for Source Device Details */
00979                 add_pmu_window = gtk_dialog_new ();
00980                 g_signal_connect (add_pmu_window, "destroy", G_CALLBACK (gtk_widget_destroy), add_pmu_window);
00981                 gtk_window_set_title (GTK_WINDOW (add_pmu_window), "Add Source Device");
00982                 gtk_container_set_border_width (GTK_CONTAINER (add_pmu_window), 10);
00983                 gtk_widget_set_size_request (add_pmu_window, 350, 350);
00984     
00985                 /* Create a table of 5 by 2 squares. */
00986                 table = gtk_table_new (5, 2, FALSE);
00987     
00988                 /* Set the spacing to 20 on x and 30 on y */
00989                 gtk_table_set_row_spacings (GTK_TABLE (table), 20);
00990                 gtk_table_set_col_spacings (GTK_TABLE (table), 30);
00991     
00992                 /* Pack the table into the window */
00993                 gtk_box_pack_start (GTK_BOX (GTK_DIALOG(add_pmu_window)->vbox), table, TRUE, TRUE, 0);
00994                 gtk_widget_show (table);
00995 
00996                 /* Add few button to the bottom of the dialog */
00997                 close_button = gtk_button_new_with_label ("close");
00998                 valdbutton = gtk_button_new_with_label ("Add");
00999                 help_button = gtk_button_new_with_label ("Help");
01000     
01001                 /* This simply creates a grid of toggle buttons on the table */
01002                 label = gtk_label_new ("-");
01003                 markup1 = g_markup_printf_escaped ("<span foreground=\"#990033\" font='12'><b>Enter Source Device Details</b></span>");
01004                 gtk_label_set_markup (GTK_LABEL (label), markup1);
01005                 gtk_table_attach_defaults (GTK_TABLE (table), label, 0, 2, 0, 1);
01006                 gtk_widget_show (label);
01007                 g_free (markup1);
01008  
01009                 label = gtk_label_new ("Source ID Code    ");
01010                 gtk_table_attach_defaults (GTK_TABLE (table), label, 0, 1, 1, 2);
01011                 gtk_widget_show (label);
01012  
01013                 label = gtk_label_new ("Source IP Address   ");
01014                 gtk_table_attach_defaults (GTK_TABLE (table), label, 0, 1, 2, 3);
01015                 gtk_widget_show (label);
01016 
01017                 label = gtk_label_new ("Source Port Number");
01018                 gtk_table_attach_defaults (GTK_TABLE (table), label, 0, 1, 3, 4);
01019                 gtk_widget_show (label);
01020  
01021                 label = gtk_label_new ("Protocol               ");
01022                 gtk_label_set_justify (GTK_LABEL (label), GTK_JUSTIFY_LEFT);
01023                 gtk_table_attach_defaults (GTK_TABLE (table), label, 0, 1, 4, 5);
01024                 gtk_widget_show (label);
01025 
01026                 /* Create text boxes for user to enter appropriate values */
01027                 p_id = gtk_entry_new();
01028                 gtk_entry_set_max_length ((GtkEntry *)p_id, 5);
01029                 gtk_table_attach_defaults (GTK_TABLE (table), p_id, 1, 2, 1, 2);
01030                 gtk_widget_show (p_id);
01031  
01032                 p_ip = gtk_entry_new();
01033                 gtk_entry_set_max_length ((GtkEntry *)p_ip, 15);
01034                 gtk_table_attach_defaults (GTK_TABLE (table), p_ip, 1, 2, 2, 3);
01035                 gtk_widget_show (p_ip);
01036 
01037                 p_port = gtk_entry_new();
01038                 gtk_entry_set_max_length ((GtkEntry *)p_port, 5);
01039                 gtk_table_attach_defaults (GTK_TABLE (table), p_port, 1, 2, 3, 4);
01040                 gtk_widget_show (p_port);
01041  
01042                 /* Create combo boxe for user with some fixed values */
01043                 p_protocol = gtk_combo_box_new_text();
01044                 gtk_combo_box_append_text(GTK_COMBO_BOX(p_protocol), "UDP");
01045                 gtk_combo_box_append_text(GTK_COMBO_BOX(p_protocol), "TCP");
01046                 gtk_combo_box_set_active(GTK_COMBO_BOX(p_protocol), 0);
01047                 gtk_table_attach_defaults (GTK_TABLE (table), p_protocol, 1, 2, 4, 5);
01048                 gtk_widget_show (p_protocol);
01049                 
01050                 /* Signal handling for buttons on Source Device Details Window */
01051                 g_signal_connect_swapped (valdbutton, "clicked", G_CALLBACK (add_pmu_validation), valdbutton);
01052                 g_signal_connect_swapped (help_button, "clicked", G_CALLBACK (ipdc_help), NULL);
01053                 g_signal_connect_swapped (close_button, "clicked", G_CALLBACK (gtk_widget_destroy), add_pmu_window);
01054     
01055                 /* This makes it so the button is the default. */
01056                 gtk_widget_set_can_default (close_button, TRUE);
01057                 gtk_widget_set_can_default (valdbutton, TRUE);
01058                 gtk_widget_set_can_default (help_button, TRUE);
01059                 gtk_box_pack_start (GTK_BOX (GTK_DIALOG (add_pmu_window)->action_area), valdbutton, TRUE, TRUE, 0);
01060                 gtk_box_pack_start (GTK_BOX (GTK_DIALOG (add_pmu_window)->action_area), help_button, TRUE, TRUE, 0);
01061                 gtk_box_pack_start (GTK_BOX (GTK_DIALOG (add_pmu_window)->action_area), close_button, TRUE, TRUE, 0);
01062     
01063                 /* This grabs this button to be the default button. Simply hitting the "Enter" key will cause this button to activate. */
01064                 gtk_widget_grab_default (valdbutton);
01065                 gtk_widget_show (valdbutton);
01066                 gtk_widget_grab_default (help_button);
01067                 gtk_widget_show (help_button);
01068                 gtk_widget_grab_default (close_button);
01069                 gtk_widget_show (close_button);
01070 
01071                 /* Finally show the add_pmu_window */
01072                 gtk_widget_show (add_pmu_window);
01073         };
01074 
01075 
01076 /* ---------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
01077 /* FUNCTION  cmd_or_remove_pmu (GtkButton *but, gpointer udata)                 */
01078 /* It is a common function for Remove Source Device and Send Different command  */
01079 /* frames to Source devices.                                                    */
01080 /* ---------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
01081 
01082         void cmd_or_remove_pmu (GtkButton *but, gpointer udata)
01083         {
01084                 /* local variables */
01085                 GtkWidget *scrolled_window;
01086                 GtkWidget *table, *close_button;
01087                 GtkWidget *valdbutton, *help_button, *label;
01088 
01089                 int on_flag = 0, off_flag = 0;
01090                 char buff[2000], line [40], *p_buff, tmp_str[20]; 
01091                 char ip[20],protocol[6],port[6],pmuid[6];
01092                 char *i,*p,*port_num,*id, *markup2;
01093                 FILE *file_1;
01094   
01095                 /* Copy the 'udata' that came along with signal to identifies which function should execute */
01096                 strcpy(find_butn,(char *) udata);
01097 
01098                 /* Create a new dialog window for the scrolled window to be packed into */
01099                 new_window = gtk_dialog_new ();
01100                 g_signal_connect (new_window, "destroy", G_CALLBACK (gtk_widget_destroy), new_window);
01101 
01102                 /* Set the window title according to fired signal */
01103                 if(!strcmp(find_butn, "1"))
01104                 {
01105                         gtk_window_set_title (GTK_WINDOW (new_window), "Remove Source Device");
01106                 }
01107                 else if(!strcmp(find_butn, "2"))
01108                 {
01109                         gtk_window_set_title (GTK_WINDOW (new_window), "Turn OFF Data Transmission");
01110                 }
01111                 else if(!strcmp(find_butn, "3"))
01112                 {
01113                         gtk_window_set_title (GTK_WINDOW (new_window), "Turn ON Data Transmission");
01114                 }
01115                 else
01116                 {
01117                         gtk_window_set_title (GTK_WINDOW (new_window), "Configuration Frame Request");
01118                 }
01119                 gtk_container_set_border_width (GTK_CONTAINER (new_window), 10);
01120                 gtk_widget_set_size_request (new_window, 450, 350);
01121     
01122                 /* Create a new scrolled window */
01123                 scrolled_window = gtk_scrolled_window_new (NULL, NULL);
01124                 gtk_container_set_border_width (GTK_CONTAINER (scrolled_window), 10);
01125 
01126                 /* The policy is one of GTK_POLICY AUTOMATIC, or GTK_POLICY_ALWAYS. GTK_POLICY_AUTOMATIC will automatically decide whether you need scrollbars,
01127                    whereas GTK_POLICY_ALWAYS will always leave the scrollbars there. The first one is the horizontal scrollbar, the second is vertical. */
01128                 gtk_scrolled_window_set_policy (GTK_SCROLLED_WINDOW (scrolled_window), GTK_POLICY_AUTOMATIC, GTK_POLICY_ALWAYS);
01129 
01130                 /* The dialog window is created with a vbox packed into it */                                                           
01131                 gtk_box_pack_start (GTK_BOX (GTK_DIALOG(new_window)->vbox), scrolled_window, TRUE, TRUE, 0);
01132                 gtk_widget_show (scrolled_window);
01133     
01134                 /* create a table of 4 by 2 squares. */
01135                 table = gtk_table_new (4, 2, FALSE);
01136     
01137                 /* Set the spacing to 15 on x and 25 on y */
01138                 gtk_table_set_row_spacings (GTK_TABLE (table), 15);
01139                 gtk_table_set_col_spacings (GTK_TABLE (table), 25);
01140     
01141                 /* Pack the table into the scrolled window */
01142                 gtk_scrolled_window_add_with_viewport (GTK_SCROLLED_WINDOW (scrolled_window), table);
01143                 gtk_widget_show (table);
01144 
01145                 memset(buff,'\0',sizeof(buff));
01146                 memset(line,'\0',40);
01147 
01148                 /* Open the file 'pdc.txt' in read mode */
01149                 file_1 = fopen ("ipaddress.txt","r");
01150                 if ((file_1 == NULL) || (fgets (line, 40,file_1) == NULL))
01151                 {
01152                         /* Place lable on a spacific position on table with text 'Sorry, No Records...!!!'*/
01153                         label = gtk_label_new (" ");
01154                         markup2 = g_markup_printf_escaped ("<span foreground=\"#990033\" font='10'><b>Sorry, No Records...!!!\n-------------------------------------------------------------------\n</b></span>");
01155                         gtk_label_set_markup (GTK_LABEL (label), markup2);
01156                         gtk_table_attach_defaults (GTK_TABLE (table), label, 1, 2, 1, 2);
01157                         gtk_widget_show (label);
01158                         g_free(markup2);
01159                 } 
01160                 else 
01161                 {
01162                         /* This simply creates a grid of toggle buttons on the table to demonstrate the scrolled window. */
01163                         label = gtk_label_new (" ");
01164                         markup2 = g_markup_printf_escaped ("<span foreground=\"#990033\" font='10'><b>Connection Details</b></span>");
01165                         gtk_label_set_markup (GTK_LABEL (label), markup2);
01166                         gtk_table_attach_defaults (GTK_TABLE (table), label, 0, 2, 0, 1);
01167                         gtk_widget_show (label);
01168                         g_free(markup2);
01169 
01170                         /* Check wether fired signal from remove source or send CFG request */
01171                         if(!strcmp(find_butn, "1") || !strcmp(find_butn, "4"))
01172                         {
01173                                 /* Open the file 'ipaddress.txt' in read mode */
01174                                 file_1 = fopen ("ipaddress.txt","r");
01175 
01176                                 /* Add the button with title according to fired signal */
01177                                 if(!strcmp(find_butn, "4"))
01178                                 {
01179                                         valdbutton = gtk_button_new_with_label ("Send");
01180                                 }
01181                                 if(!strcmp(find_butn, "1"))
01182                                 {
01183                                         valdbutton = gtk_button_new_with_label ("Remove");      
01184                                 }
01185                                         
01186                                 p_buff = " -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------\n|   Source ID  |            IP           |       Port      |     Protocol    |\n-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------\n";
01187                                 strcat(buff, p_buff);
01188                                 memset(line,'\0',40);
01189 
01190                                 while (fgets (line, 40,file_1) != NULL)         
01191                                 { 
01192                                         memset(ip,'\0',20);
01193                                         memset(port,'\0',6);
01194                                         memset(protocol,'\0',6);
01195                                         memset(pmuid,'\0',6);
01196 
01197                                         /* Read the file data seprated by spaces and store into pointers */
01198                                         id = strtok (line," "); 
01199                                         i = strtok (NULL," "); 
01200                                         port_num = strtok (NULL," "); 
01201                                         p = strtok (NULL," "); 
01202                                 
01203                                         /* Copy the data into variables */
01204                                         strcpy(pmuid, id);
01205                                         strcpy(ip, i);
01206                                         strcpy(port, port_num);
01207                                         strcpy(protocol, p);
01208         
01209                                         /* Concate all the data into a big buffer */
01210                                         strcat(buff, "|     ");
01211                                         strcat(buff, pmuid);
01212                                         strcat(buff, "\t\t");
01213                                         strcat(buff, ip);
01214                                         strcat(buff, "\t\t");
01215                                         strcat(buff, port);
01216                                         strcat(buff, "\t    ");
01217                                         strncat(buff, protocol, 3);
01218                                         strcat(buff, "       |\n");
01219                                         strcat(buff, "-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------\n");
01220                                 }
01221                                 fclose (file_1);
01222                         }
01223 
01224                         else if(!strcmp(find_butn, "2"))        /* if signal fired from send Transmission OFF request to Source device */
01225                         {
01226                                 if(LLfirst != NULL)
01227                                 {
01228                                         /* Add a "Send" button to the bottom of the dialog */
01229                                         valdbutton = gtk_button_new_with_label ("Send");
01230                                         struct Lower_Layer_Details *t = LLfirst;
01231 
01232                                         p_buff = " -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------\n|   Source ID  |            IP           |       Port      |     Protocol    |\n-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------\n";
01233                                         strcat(buff, p_buff);
01234         
01235                                         while(t != NULL)
01236                                         {
01237                                                 if(t->data_transmission_off == 0)
01238                                                 {
01239                                                         /* Concate all the data into a big buffer */
01240                                                         memset(tmp_str,'\0',sizeof(tmp_str));
01241                                                         sprintf(tmp_str, "%d", t->pmuid);
01242                                                         strcat(buff, "|     ");
01243                                                         strcat(buff, tmp_str);
01244                                                         strcat(buff, "\t\t");   
01245                                                         strcat(buff, t->ip);
01246                                                         strcat(buff, "\t\t");
01247                                                         memset(tmp_str,'\0',sizeof(tmp_str));
01248                                                         sprintf(tmp_str, "%d", t->port);
01249                                                         strcat(buff, tmp_str);
01250                                                         strcat(buff, "\t    ");
01251                                                         strncat(buff, t->protocol, 3);
01252                                                         strcat(buff, "       |\n");
01253                                                         strcat(buff, "-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------\n");
01254                                                         off_flag = 1;
01255                                                 }
01256                                                 t = t->next;
01257                                         }                       
01258                                 }
01259                         }       
01260 
01261                         else if(!strcmp(find_butn, "3"))        /* if signal fired from send Transmission ON request to Source device */
01262                         {
01263                                 if(LLfirst != NULL)
01264                                 {
01265                                         /* Add a "Send" button to the bottom of the dialog */
01266                                         valdbutton = gtk_button_new_with_label ("Send");
01267                                         struct Lower_Layer_Details *t = LLfirst;
01268 
01269                                         p_buff = " -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------\n|   Source ID  |            IP           |       Port      |     Protocol    |\n-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------\n";
01270                                         strcat(buff, p_buff);
01271         
01272                                         while(t != NULL)
01273                                         {
01274                                                 if(t->data_transmission_off == 1)
01275                                                 {
01276                                                         strcat(buff, "|\t");
01277                                                         memset(tmp_str,'\0',sizeof(tmp_str));
01278                                                         sprintf(tmp_str, "%d", t->pmuid);
01279                                                         strcat(buff, tmp_str);
01280                                                         strcat(buff, "\t\t\t");
01281                                                         strcat(buff, t->ip);
01282                                                         strcat(buff, "\t\t");
01283                                                         memset(tmp_str,'\0',sizeof(tmp_str));
01284                                                         sprintf(tmp_str, "%d", t->port);
01285                                                         strcat(buff, tmp_str);
01286                                                         strcat(buff, "\t\t");
01287                                                         strcat(buff, t->protocol);
01288                                                         strcat(buff, "\t|\n");
01289                                                         strcat(buff, "-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------\n");
01290                                                         on_flag = 1;
01291                                                 }
01292                                                 t = t->next;
01293                                         }                       
01294                                 }
01295                         }       
01296 
01297                         /* Simply check for source objects whose Transmission is not OFF  (or ON)*/
01298                         if ((!strcmp(find_butn, "2")) && (off_flag == 0))
01299                         {
01300                                 /* Place lable on a spacific position on table with text 'Sorry, No Records...!!!'*/
01301                                 label = gtk_label_new (" ");
01302                                 markup2 = g_markup_printf_escaped ("<span foreground=\"#990033\" font='10'><b>Sorry, No Records...!!!\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------\n</b></span>");
01303                                 gtk_label_set_markup (GTK_LABEL (label), markup2);
01304                                 gtk_table_attach_defaults (GTK_TABLE (table), label, 1, 2, 1, 2);
01305                                 gtk_widget_show (label);
01306                                 g_free(markup2);
01307                         }
01308                         else if ((!strcmp(find_butn, "3")) && (on_flag == 0))   /* Simply check for source objects whose Transmission is not ON (or OFF) */
01309                         {
01310                                 /* Place lable on a spacific position on table with text 'Sorry, No Records...!!!'*/
01311                                 label = gtk_label_new (" ");
01312                                 markup2 = g_markup_printf_escaped ("<span foreground=\"#990033\" font='10'><b>Sorry, No Records...!!!\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------\n</b></span>");
01313                                 gtk_label_set_markup (GTK_LABEL (label), markup2);
01314                                 gtk_table_attach_defaults (GTK_TABLE (table), label, 1, 2, 1, 2);
01315                                 gtk_widget_show (label);
01316                                 g_free(markup2);
01317                         }
01318                         else
01319                         {
01320                                 /* This simply creates a grid of toggle buttons on the table to demonstrate the scrolled window. */
01321                                 label = gtk_label_new (buff);
01322                                 gtk_table_attach_defaults (GTK_TABLE (table), label, 0, 2, 1, 2);
01323                                 gtk_widget_show (label);
01324                  
01325                                 label = gtk_label_new ("Source ID Code   :");
01326                                 gtk_table_attach_defaults (GTK_TABLE (table), label, 0, 1, 2, 3);
01327                                 gtk_widget_show (label);
01328                  
01329                                 label = gtk_label_new ("Protocol         :");
01330                                 gtk_table_attach_defaults (GTK_TABLE (table), label, 0, 1, 3, 4);
01331                                 gtk_widget_show (label);
01332 
01333                                 /* Create text boxes for user to enter appropriate values */
01334                                 p_id = gtk_entry_new();
01335                                 gtk_entry_set_max_length ((GtkEntry *)p_id, 5);
01336                                 gtk_table_attach_defaults (GTK_TABLE (table), p_id, 1, 2, 2, 3);
01337                                 gtk_widget_show (p_id);
01338                  
01339                                 /* Create combo boxe for user with some fixed values */
01340                                 p_protocol = gtk_combo_box_new_text();
01341                                 gtk_combo_box_append_text(GTK_COMBO_BOX(p_protocol), "UDP");
01342                                 gtk_combo_box_append_text(GTK_COMBO_BOX(p_protocol), "TCP");
01343                                 gtk_combo_box_set_active(GTK_COMBO_BOX(p_protocol), 0);
01344                                 gtk_table_attach_defaults (GTK_TABLE (table), p_protocol, 1, 2, 3, 4);
01345                                 gtk_widget_show (p_protocol);
01346 
01347                                 /* Add a "Help" button to the bottom of the dialog */
01348                                 help_button = gtk_button_new_with_label ("Help");
01349 
01350                                 /* Signal handling for buttons on Window */
01351                                 g_signal_connect_swapped (valdbutton, "clicked", G_CALLBACK (cmd_or_remove_pmu_validation), valdbutton);
01352                                 g_signal_connect_swapped (help_button, "clicked", G_CALLBACK (ipdc_help), NULL);
01353                     
01354                                 /* This makes it so the button is the default. */
01355                                 gtk_widget_set_can_default (valdbutton, TRUE);
01356                                 gtk_widget_set_can_default (help_button, TRUE);
01357                                 gtk_box_pack_start (GTK_BOX (GTK_DIALOG (new_window)->action_area), valdbutton, TRUE, TRUE, 0);
01358                                 gtk_box_pack_start (GTK_BOX (GTK_DIALOG (new_window)->action_area), help_button, TRUE, TRUE, 0);
01359                     
01360                                 /* This grabs this button to be the default button. Simply hitting the "Enter" key will cause this button to activate. */
01361                                 gtk_widget_grab_default (valdbutton);
01362                                 gtk_widget_show (valdbutton);
01363                                 gtk_widget_grab_default (help_button);
01364                                 gtk_widget_show (help_button);
01365                         }
01366                 }
01367 
01368                 /* Add a "Close" button to the bottom of the dialog */
01369                 close_button = gtk_button_new_with_label ("Close");
01370                 g_signal_connect_swapped (close_button, "clicked", G_CALLBACK (gtk_widget_destroy), new_window);
01371                 gtk_widget_set_can_default (close_button, TRUE);
01372                 gtk_box_pack_start (GTK_BOX (GTK_DIALOG (new_window)->action_area), close_button, TRUE, TRUE, 0);
01373                 gtk_widget_grab_default (close_button);
01374                 gtk_widget_show (close_button);
01375                 on_flag = 0, off_flag = 0;
01376 
01377                 /* Finally show the new_window */
01378                 gtk_widget_show (new_window);
01379         };
01380
